Trebatius is with me, a real man and a loyal citizen. Ye gods, what awful news he brings! So even Balbus is thinking of attending the Senate! But Ι will give Trebatius himself a letter for you to- morrow. I agree with your letter that Vettienus is friendly to me. But Ι made a rather bitter jest at his expense, because he wrote curtly to me about paying my debt. Appease him, if he took it in bad part. I addressed him by his title “ commissioner of the mint ” because he addressed me as “ proconsul.’' But since he is a good man and has affection for me, let me keep my affection for him. Farewell.
